LAPAROSCOPIC BX PERITONEAL NODULE PERI PANCREACTIC MASS GASTROSCOPY AND BX MALL ESOPHAGEAL JUNCTION OTHER TREATMENTS / PROCEDURES ( NOT IN O.R. ) NONE BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE : to be written BRIEF RESUME OF HOSPITAL COURSE ADDENDUM 1: 57 y / o gentleman w/ Hx of abdominal pain since ca . 1 year . A ct scan performed revealed a pancreatic mass in body and tail . He now presents for staging laparoscopy to rule out metastatic disease . The procedure was performed on 11/26 and was uneventful . The laparoscopy revealed local extention of pancreatic mas to the stomach w / o evidence of carcinomatosis . Postoperative lyhe had some nausea , therefore his diet was advanced very slowly . However , he was able to tolerate house diet and was discharged home instable condition . Pathology revealed pancreatic adeno-carcinoma , however , the final report is still pending .
